title: Template metacharacters make it really hard to output go code (or code in general)
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Run http://pastie.org/743777
2. In order to output go code, you have to replace all brackets with 
{.meta-left} and {.meta-right} . This gets annoying really quickly. It's 
probably the same if you're template is source code. 

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The template language shouldn't use simple brackets as default 
metacharacters.

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
linux/386

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
a33ae1785d42+ (+==<) tip

Please provide any additional information below.
There's a template language that's similar to json-template called mustache 
. http://github.com/defunkt/mustache . It's picked up some momentum in the 
ruby community. In that language, meta-characters are double brackets '{{' 
and '}}'. It also supports the ability to change metacharacters. 

I think something like mustache would be a good fit for the go std lib; I'd 
be willing to implement it if you're interested.
